question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Configuration bypass] Can an attacker provide a malicious config file path that exploits path traversal to load arbitrary configuration files, potentially compromising validator keys or consensus parameters? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Authentication bypass] In test mode, does the node properly validate that test configurations are never used in production, or can an attacker launch a production node with test security parameters bypassing authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_and_report_ports()] [Panic handler manipulation] Can an attacker trigger conditions that bypass the panic handler setup, allowing the node to crash without proper crash reporting and potentially losing critical safety data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_and_report_ports()] [Identity spoofing] Does aptos_node_identity::init() properly validate peer IDs, or can a malicious node initialize with a stolen or forged peer ID to impersonate validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_and_report_ports()] [Resource limit bypass] Can ensure_max_open_files_limit() be manipulated through config to set dangerously low file descriptor limits causing database corruption or consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_and_report_ports()] [Feature flag attack] Are testing and fuzzing features properly disabled in production builds, or can an attacker enable them through configuration manipulation to bypass security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_and_report_ports()] [Failpoint injection] Can failpoint configuration be exploited to inject malicious failpoints at runtime, forcing validators to crash or produce invalid blocks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: start_and_report_ports()] [Failpoint warning bypass] Does the failpoint warning mechanism alert operators when failpoints are active, or can an attacker silently enable failpoints without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [Database initialization race] Are there race conditions during database initialization where concurrent access could corrupt genesis state or validator sets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [Chain ID manipulation] Can the chain_id fetched from the database be manipulated to force validators onto wrong chains causing network splits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [AptosVM configuration attack] Can set_aptos_vm_configurations() be exploited to set malicious VM parameters that bypass gas limits or enable unauthorized operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [State sync race condition] Does block_until_initialized() properly ensure state sync completion, or can consensus start with incomplete state causing safety violations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [Service initialization order] Can the order of service initialization be exploited where later services depend on earlier ones not fully initialized, leading to undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_environment_and_start_node()] [Admin service privilege escalation] Does the admin service properly authenticate requests, or can unauthorized users access mempool controls and database interfaces? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Test mode detection bypass] Can production nodes accidentally or maliciously run in test mode with weakened security, allowing single-validator control and compromised consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_test_environment_and_start_node()] [Temporary directory manipulation] Can attackers predict or manipulate the temporary test directory location to inject malicious state or steal validator keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: setup_test_environment_and_start_node()] [Test config override injection] Can test_config_override_path be exploited to override critical security parameters like validator keys or consensus thresholds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: load_node_config()] [Config path traversal] Does validator_config_path properly sanitize paths, or can directory traversal attacks access sensitive files outside test directories? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Genesis manipulation] Can malicious genesis frameworks be provided to create compromised test networks with backdoored validators or unlimited minting? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [RNG seed prediction] Is the random seed properly protected, or can attackers predict validator keys and consensus randomness by analyzing seed values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Port randomization bypass] When random_ports is disabled, can attackers exploit fixed ports to perform man-in-the-middle attacks on validator communications? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Lazy mode exploitation] Can lazy mode's u64::MAX poll count be exploited to prevent block production even when transactions exist, causing liveness failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Performance mode resource exhaustion] Does performance mode properly limit resource usage, or can it cause system-wide DoS through excessive concurrency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Concurrency level manipulation] Can execution.concurrency_level be set to extreme values causing deadlocks or resource exhaustion in the execution engine? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Quorum store backpressure bypass] Can dynamic_max_txn_per_s=10000 be exploited to flood the network with transactions bypassing normal rate limits? (Medium)
